body:
Hello Everyone!

The Seniors and I are happy to announce a new feature today that will make credits useful on a new platform, TeamSpeak!

That's right, you read that correctly, you can now use credits to create temporary channels in TS!



Just message the bot !tempchannel to get started. Once you run the command a second time to confirm, a channel will be created, you will moved, and be given administrator privileges in that channel.
These channels are set with a time limit, but have no fear, you can extend the channel up to as long as you want (at a price)!

The pricing structure is as follows:

Rank Creation Price Initial Time  Creation Cooldown Extension CostExtension TIme
Diamond 0 30m 3h 1,00010m
Emerald 0 15m 3h 1,00010m
Normal 1,000 10m 0 1,00010m

NOTE: If your rank is not listed here, you fall under the "Normal" pricing structure

We hope you enjoy,
Stay Tuned!
body_tagged:
Hello Everyone!

The Seniors and I are happy to announce a new feature today that will make credits useful on a new platform, TeamSpeak!

That's right, you read that correctly, you can now use credits to create temporary channels in TS!



Just message the bot !tempchannel to get started. Once you run the command a second time to confirm, a channel will be created, you will moved, and be given administrator privileges in that channel.
These channels are set with a time limit, but have no fear, you can extend the channel up to as long as you want (at a price)!

The pricing structure is as follows:

Rank Creation Price Initial Time  Creation Cooldown Extension CostExtension TIme
Diamond 0 30m 3h 1,00010m
Emerald 0 15m 3h 1,00010m
Normal 1,000 10m 0 1,00010m

NOTE: If your rank is not listed here, you fall under the "Normal" pricing structure

We hope you enjoy,
Stay Tuned!
title: Credits Just Became More Useful

replies.body:
My reaction to this was "What the fuck?!"

I'm trying real hard not to be toxic but that's pretty fucking difficult after reading that, but why would people spend credits like this when:

a) They can just chill in a public channel
b) They can just chill in a team channel
c) They can just join another TS
d) They can just use skype instead

Can time please be spent on more useful things, IDK, like getting the playerbase over 30?

As much as I dislike this guy you've got to agree with him. Hypixel and/or Mineplex developed their skywars way more than what Avicus did, and it's much more fun when it's well developed, so of course people would rather play on Hypixel/Mineplex than on here.

replies.body:
You're not breaking any rules, and you can continue if you honestly want to.

If you want to tell someone that something they worked hard on isn't going to work, usually you do it in a more proper manner. Like being constructive, and offering suggestions. 

I wouldn't really advise acting like this anywhere, especially outside of the internet where things you say and the way you act could seriously affect your future.
https://avicus.net/forums/discussions/4d4628689?page=4#reply341490
https://avicus.net/forums/discussions/13ee8c1ed?reply=341553
https://avicus.net/forums/discussions/338f0508d?reply=341376
https://avicus.net/forums/discussions/4d4628689?page=4#reply341268
https://avicus.net/forums/discussions/4d4628689?reply=341314

And if these posts seem okay to you, I'd definitely take a look at that web ban you got. That's got to say something about your forums behavior.
https://avicus.net/punishments/660686

Anyways, this has gone off track from the forum topic.

edit - if you say it's not your problem, then stop caring about the issues. It shows you care by making these posts, even if it's a horrible way of getting your point across.
